description: National Highways says the accident leads to a "substantial fuel spillage" and a lot of debris.
title: Road between St Neots and Caxton reopens after lorry crash
title_page: Road between St Neots and Caxton reopens after lorry crash - BBC News
maintext:
An A-road has reopened after a lorry crashed and caused a fuel spill.
National Highways said the A428 was shut, external eastbound in Cambridgeshire between the B1428 at St Neots and the A1198 at Caxton following the early-morning incident.
A "substantial fuel spillage and a large amount of debris" needed dealing with, it added.
The road was open again shortly after 06:30 GMT.
